etymology.description: semantic: 殳 ‘strike, weapon’ + phonetic: 意 (yì).
etymology.interpretation: Built with 殳 suggesting an action associated with harm or impact, while 意 provides the yì sound. The sense developed to denote the groaning sound made in pain or distress.

examples.chinese: 他疼得殹了一声(他疼得殹了一聲)。
examples.pinyin: Tā téng de yì le yī shēng.
examples.english: He was in such pain that he let out a groan.

examples.chinese: 病人醒来时(病人醒來時)，还在轻轻殹着(還在輕輕殹著)。
examples.pinyin: Bìngrén xǐnglái shí, hái zài qīngqīng yì zhe.
examples.english: When the patient woke up, he was still softly moaning.

examples.chinese: 听到他殹个不停(聽到他殹個不停)，护士赶紧安慰他(護士趕緊安慰他)。
examples.pinyin: Tīngdào tā yì ge bù tíng, hùshi gǎnjǐn ānwèi tā.
examples.english: Hearing him groan nonstop, the nurse quickly comforted him.
